documents.document: Back to @IRA_INAF tomorrow where I will attempt to answer the question of can I finish another paper this week?
Great visit to @RUastro this week, lots of interesting astrophysics discussions & good science. Many thanks @Astro_Jamie for the invite!
I've got no words. I hope the EU takes appropriate action. https://t.co/if97WQxBTW
When you come from the antipodes you don't often see your name associated with an institution that dates to 1088 :) https://t.co/I5TeScHh4t
@VeronikaMeduna @drsciman, @VicUniWgtn Engineering also has 3D printing, but the ones in the design school are v. high quality.
@matisidro thanks. I think this one on the same topic, given two weeks later also in Christchurch, is better: https://t.co/9vHsfxDR67
@stingay @realscientists Well, the overall funding rates are still low, though it is true my group did exceptionally well in 2016.
@m_onlein @novp - this was SCPS too.
@m_onlein @novp there are such people closer than you think. The bring your sick kids to work to infect my kids episode was interesting.
Hey @theartofnight love your image in day 8 of the Wellington Advent Calendar - absolutely stunning!
Have arrived at Berkeley, have my desk for the week, have my talk mostly written. Now to get through this massive amount of work...
@BigData2017IAS @piccolomud to many women has helped for other fields. Best of luck to improve in the future. 3/3
@BigData2017IAS @piccolomud male-dominated field you often get invitations with too little notice, or you get too many. Invite early &...2/n
@BigData2017IAS @piccolomud Perhaps next time you could try more women, earlier for both the org. comm. and speakers. As a woman in a ...1/n
@BigData2017IAS @piccolomud 27 speakers and all men, I'm pretty sure that's statistically very unlikely to be representative of researchers.
@astro_jje Indeed you are! So all topics on the table? Cool.
@astro_jje *you're* - I really need type better lest autocorrect make me illiterate
@astro_jje guess it depends on why your talking to them :)
@astro_jje given the lack of postdoc funding in NZ, few of these ppl will get permanent jobs in unis, but that this isn't their only option
Everyone in Christchurch has been so nice, the weather is great, the public art & gardens fantastic and they do a mean coffee!
@astro_jje that not all research careers need universities? U can do meaningful stuff outside the feudal uni structure & some of them will.
@NJRattenbury @astro_jje @REasther Thanks for coming! It did indeed go well :)
@hendysh yes, have encountered many people in denial recently; it's incredibly frustrating. Publishing data would help.
@hendysh Thanks for posting this, but what are we going to do about it? I'm sick to death of this, it is soul destroying.
Very nice paper by @cjriseley, all aspects of the work are done well. https://t.co/MjY7hUNhnU
@astro_jje @MarsdenFund and Pauline Harris has an astro related social science project on Maori calendars 2/2
@astro_jje @MarsdenFund There are actually 3 traditional astro projects. Cathie Zheng, my postdoc, got a fast start which I'm on also. 1/2
@m_onlein @MarsdenFund Thanks :) Also Cathie Zheng, my postdoc, got a fast start which I'm on also, for a related project, which is great.
@m_onlein ok, thanks.
@m_onlein do you know if the Science Dean is around atm?
@m_onlein they are embargoed.
@theartofnight glad you liked the talk. FWIW I love your images of the sky at night :)
Thanks @TEDxChCh what a great day! https://t.co/Jy1jX6Pu4v
Me talking about MWA, SKA and radio astronomy with @JMulliganRNZ ahead of today's @TEDxChCh https://t.co/JsiebhmmTS
See you there :) https://t.co/TAS4OVJnIP
Everyone involved in hiring/promotion pls read this: https://t.co/L3YRRekHYK @CEWAus's how to avoid gender & other bias in meritocracies
@NJRattenbury Well I hope @RayPNorris said something good :) I really wanted to be at IAU 325 but couldn't due to prep for @TEDxChCh
@DrPaulHancock @Cosmic_Horizons So I think it very much depends on what the talk is for as to if there should be a speaking fee 3/3
@DrPaulHancock @Cosmic_Horizons While science promotion is v. important, if ppl are making $ off your talk, I think you should be paid. 2/3
@DrPaulHancock @Cosmic_Horizons the vast majority of my public talks were unpaid, but I have been paid in the past too. 1/3
@L_Pratley giving my talk at CALIM on CLEANing polarisation data properly: see our paper: https://t.co/CuGaKCakst https://t.co/a40miIHX2d
@L_Pratley's paper on testing image reconstruction algorithms motivated by compressive sensing on real data. https://t.co/ArBgipjwhl
@m_onlein Ah! Congrats! :)
@brendonbrewer you can't answer that correctly without more context; with the information at hand, both options could be correct.
@m_onlein Yeah, I saw that, it's pretty accurate.
@stingay @SKA_telescope yep. Also should update the values for MWA and add HERA.
@stingay @SKA_telescope good point, should have a footnote.
@SKA_telescope Were the areas of the circles supposed to be proportional to collecting area? If so, FAST needs to be much bigger...
@m_onlein No worries, it would have been a shame to waste such a good cake :)
Made a storify record of #RonFest : https://t.co/yYIYKERO2S I can add photos, video etc to it from all public social media.
@AstroJoeC You've been quoted in my #Storify story "RonFest" https://t.co/yYIYKEAdbk
My pleasure. Happy Birthday Ron! https://t.co/DhT5yJX9m0
@AstroJoeC That's a cool photo. I have no photos of Ron and I, so I'm pinching this!
@elenchically It was a good meeting, thanks for coming!
@SKA_telescope session today at #RonFest in Queenstown with presentations from Richard Schilizzi, @SKA_Australia and @SKA_Africa
"I'd put my hand in the fire, for Ron" - Mark Walker quoting an anonymous CSIRO staff member #RonFest
@AstroJoeC "The spectral revolution has occurred!" #RonFest
@timcornwell says Ron's management genius was mandating free coffee and Mexican food 3 days a week! #RonFest
@timcornwell says the VLA was a happy innovative place in the 80's largely due to Ron #RonFest
Eggs on Legs! Douglas Bock reminds us of Luneburg Lens as originally considered for SKA #RonFest
Douglas Bock now discussing Ron's impact and changes at ATNF - huge impact! #RonFest
@cosmicpudding @ron_ekers Yes, that is a surprise!
@NZScienceLearn @MaisonValentino Very, cool :)
@REasther @VeronikaMeduna pity about the bit where they feel the need to mention her personal life so people can judge her choices :(
This is cool! https://t.co/0ryPXaEOBy
Thanks, for inviting me to join your cult and allow me the opportunity to be subject to your will. Think I'll pass. #CollaborationFail
@JossBlandHawtho Cherokee peace flag
The @mwatelescope is a finalist for the #Eureka16 Prize for Excellence in International Scientific Collaboration https://t.co/vFWGPQW30Q
@RoshMccool Yep. Of course NDAs are not just used in SH settlements, other settled discrimination issues often have NDAs applied.
@SciBry shame because you don't know these words or you do? I got 9/10 - still an Aussie :)
@naomimcgriff Wow! That is an awesome example!
@hendysh @hendysh Ok. The article should say that. Plus, still not convinced 'AU looks to UK' is a fair statement from those data.
@hendysh AU equidist to UK and Japan/China. @AucklandUni seems to look to US to me. Not clear what NZ overall does since only Auck. on plot
@hendysh precisely the comment I just left on the blog. Only 7/40 AU unis included in those data. AU seems closer to Canada than UK. 1/2
@hendysh @AucklandUni I'm not actually seeing any evidence to back that statement up in the linked article.
One exam to set and then I'm done with teaching. This makes me very happy.
Very sad to hear of the passing of Bruce. His 70-year career in radio astronomy was remarkable. He will be missed. https://t.co/Er0FH9orIN
@franco_vazza congratulations to both you and Annalisa for your ERC grants!
At the airport after the amazingly good #BruceSlee meeting. Have been told the bar is high for #RonFest, but I think we can make it!
@piccolomud @brendonbrewer they are huge, but not bigger then having to pack 4 different ones. No issues re fit - mine not an input overlay.
@brendonbrewer @piccolomud get an all purpose one. I have one and it's awesome - I never have to think about this anymore.
@REasther What?! You don't want to demonstrate your immense contribution to the field of Nanotechnology?
@REasther ha! me too - and pretty much exactly at the same time (got mine 50min ago).
Ah sexism is alive and well in NZ. Apparently a woman with some stats is "combative", "divisive" and a source of fear.
@Knhannah hmm... other theme on twitter tonight is how overloaded academics are. When should we get out and engage? Can't really sleep less!
Not sure why postdocs think work conditions improve with a permanent job. They don't for many people. https://t.co/m0AXTolcqV
@m_onlein sorry, to* (hate appearing illiterate)
@m_onlein No, not at all. It's only cheesy when the Editor forces you too (which recently happened to me).
@naomimcgriff @taraxmurphy @lisaharveysmith Board were not asked about the locations. We were informed after 1st announcements were out.
@AstroJoeC @lindaunobel Good to know the AAS weren't the issue. Overall, what is the gender balance of the delegates like?
@AstroJoeC @lindaunobel Joe, mate, please tell me the Australian delegation has some women...?
@naomimcgriff They haven't been on enough telecons... might be that they can't hear, I look then. Actually you are hard to hear on this one!
@matisidro never picked you as an Aussie...
Greece might be my new favourite country! Swam in the sea, drank lots of raki, met interesting ppl, ate divine food... awesome :)
Off to a new country today: Greece!
@RKPriestley @m_onlein I track my hours. So I can answer that numerically. So far this year on a 'good' week it's 67hrs, last week was 81.
@naomimcgriff @ausnetman also apparently too full /tired to spell! *your. Must go write a schedule file and have a nap!
@naomimcgriff @ausnetman absolutely! You're karma is all balanced. Also same problem: too much to juggle, brain is full.
@naomimcgriff @ausnetman thanks to this tweet you've reminded me I have to observe on Monday which I had totally forgotten!
@matisidro @PolarMediaUK @SKA_telescope Great photo of Maria!
